New Records: India displaced South Africa at the top of the standings with 12 points in six matches.
Key Match Events: Rohit's superb 87, which would have been equivalent to 100-125 on any other pitch
England crashed to 129 all out as India came away with a victory
Shami picked up his fourth by bowling Rashid all ends up
Bumrah yorks Wood to end the match once and for all
Willey punishes Bumrah by hooking him high over deep fine leg for half a dozen
Post-Match Reflections: Rohit, who is adjudged the player of the match, had this to say: ‘Looking at where we were after the first 10 overs, it was important to create a partnership, which myself and KL [Rahul] did.’
‘It wasn’t about just playing my shots, but also using my experience. It was necessary to take the game as deep as possible and try to get to a decent total,’ he said.
Miscellaneous Highlights: India remain the sole undefeated team in the tournament
England had a great chance at winning this match at the interval and Buttler will have much to contemplate as their side’s chances of progression look even more scant
Others: India next face Sri Lanka on November 2, while England face old adversaries, Australia, on November 4 in what is undoubtedly a must-win match
